ScopeNote.notesText: Úsese para fotografías de la tierra tomadas desde una aeronave. Para fotografías tomadas desde más allá de la atmosfera terrestre, use "fotografía espacial". Para fotografías de cuerpos celestes o fenómenos atronómicos, use "astrofotografía".

Contributor.fullName: Centro de Documentación de Bienes Patrimoniales (Dirección de Bibliotecas, Archivos y Museos; Santiago, Chile)

ScopeNote.notesText: Foto's van de aarde gemaakt vanuit een luchtvaartuig. Gebruik 'luchtaanzichten' wanneer de nadruk ligt op het onderwerp dat in beeld gebracht is vanuit een luchtvaartuig of een ander hoog gezichtspunt. Gebruik 'ruimtefoto's' voor foto's die van buiten de dampkring van de aarde zijn gemaakt. Gebruik 'astrofoto's' voor foto's van hemellichamen of astronomische verschijnselen.

Contributor.fullName: Bureau AAT, RKD (Netherlands Institute for Art History; The Hague, The Netherlands)

tgn:Place.name: industrial center
tgn:Place.description: developed after Civil War, especially known for automobile production that was initially encouraged by Henry Ford

tgn:Place.name: transportation center
tgn:Place.description: for major water traffic from Lakes Erie to St. Clair since 1818, today also for rail, road & air traffic

tgn:Place.name: agricultural center
tgn:Place.description: has long been center for processing & forwarding agricultural produce, especially noted for flour-milling

tgn:Place.name: university center
tgn:Place.description: for Wayne State, University of Detroit, also center for Cranbrook Academy of Art, Institute of Art & other institutions

tgn:Place.name: cultural center
tgn:Place.description: has museums of art & transportation, symphony orchestra; noted for development of music including rhythm & blues, & jazz

tgn:Place.name: capital
tgn:Place.description: of Michigan Territory, from 1805; of Michigan state, from 1837 until the capital was transferred to Lansing in 1847

tgn:Place.name: inhabited place
tgn:Place.description: Amerindians lived in the area prior to arrival of Europeans; post founded by Frenchman Antoine de Lamothe Cadillac in 1701

tgn:TGN.tgn:Note: Located on Detroit river; French established fort & fur-trading post here in 1701; captured by British in French and Indian Wars in 1760; passed to US in 1796; destroyed by fire in 1805; city was rebuilt and flourished after introduction of steamboats.
